column2: Respect can be hard enough to earn when you aren't 4 feet tall, but from small beginnings can come great things.
All finally know your worth, but much more is still to be proven.
Maintaining power can be done in various ways, fear of assassination and torture is certainly one way.
The secret and rare magics of the greenskin slaves can somewhat harnessed by those ascertain respect and admiration, and with the patience to learn.
A Khan of the volcano tribes, well known and well respected by the Dawi Zhar and the Dark Father.
Experience in command exerts its own internal influences.
There is much value in utilising the wilds.
The Dawi Zharr are essential allies of the Hobgoblin tribes.
Experience in command also exerts external influence, if one knows how to communicate it.
